Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the RADIOCREMVAL project as outlined in the consent form?
A) The project is a commercial venture to promote a new skincare product.
B) The project is a research study to develop a protective cream against radiodermatitis caused by radiotherapy.
C) The project is a routine medical treatment for existing conditions without any research component.
D) The project is a survey of patient satisfaction with current dermatological treatments.

Correct answer: B) The project is a research study to develop a protective cream against radiodermatitis caused by radiotherapy.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How long is the total duration of the study for each participant from the initial visit to the final follow-up after treatment?
A) 2 weeks; B) 6 weeks; C) 8 weeks; D) 10 weeks

Correct answer: C) 8 weeks

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding any additional costs to the subject for participating in the RADIOCREMVAL study?
A) Participants will have to purchase the study creams at their own expense.
B) Participants will be provided with the study creams free of charge for the duration of the study.
C) Participants will be reimbursed for travel expenses to the clinic visits.
D) Participants will receive a stipend for each clinic visit they attend.

Correct answer: B) Participants will be provided with the study creams free of charge for the duration of the study.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
How often will patients be required to apply the study cream during the course of the research study?

A) Once a day until the end of the treatment.
B) Twice a day, starting two days before and during radiation therapy until the end of the treatment.
C) Only at the beginning and at the end of the radiation therapy.
D) Three times a week throughout the study period.

Correct answer: B) Twice a day, starting two days before and during radiation therapy until the end of the treatment.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What will happen if you choose to withdraw your consent to participate in the RADIOCREMVAL study?
A) You will be required to reimburse the cost of the creams provided during the study; B) Your medical care will be adversely affected as a result of your withdrawal; C) You may request the destruction of all identifiable samples previously obtained to prevent further analysis; D) You will be obligated to continue participation until the study's completion.

Correct answer: C

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
Questions:
Which of the following procedures is considered experimental in the RADIOCREMVAL study?
A) Standard care with commercially available creams for radiodermatitis; B) Use of a thermograph to measure skin temperature during visits; C) Application of a new radioprotective and radiomitigating cream under investigation; D) Completion of quality of life surveys related to radiodermatitis toxicity

Correct answer: C

Topics: The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants will be included in the RADIOCREMVAL study?
A) 50; B) 82; C) 100; D) 120
Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential risk or discomfort that participants may experience in the RADIOCREMVAL study?
A) Severe allergic reactions to the cream; B) Development of radiodermitis grade 3-4; C) Increased risk of cancer due to cream application; D) Permanent skin discoloration

Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential benefit to subjects participating in the RADIOCREMVAL study?
A) Guaranteed reduction in the severity of radiodermatitis to grade 1
B) More thorough and controlled evaluation of radiodermatitis with innovative equipment
C) Financial compensation for the time spent participating in the study
D) Immediate improvement in overall health

Correct answer: B) More thorough and controlled evaluation of radiodermatitis with innovative equipment

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
Questions:
What are the alternative treatments available for patients who choose not to participate in the RADIOCREMVAL study?
A) Patients can opt for standard radiation therapy without the use of any cream; B) Patients will be provided with a different experimental cream not being studied; C) Patients can choose to receive only commercial creams that are commonly used to mitigate the effects of radiation therapy; D) There are no alternative treatments available for these patients.

Correct answer: C

Topics: A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Who is responsible for ensuring the confidentiality of your personal data in the RADIOCREMVAL study?
A) The Principal Investigator only; B) The Principal Investigator and the Promoter; C) The Hospital Universitario y Polit√©cnico la Fe only; D) Only the health authorities when required

Correct answer: B) The Principal Investigator and the Promoter

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
If you experience an injury as a result of participating in the RADIOCREMVAL study, which of the following statements is true regarding compensation and medical treatment?
A) The study will provide free medical treatment for any injury directly caused by the study.
B) The study will compensate you financially for any injury related to the study.
C) The study does not arrange for free treatment or any other type of payment for injuries.
D) All injuries will be treated and billed to the study, regardless of their relation to the study.

Correct answer: C) The study does not arrange for free treatment or any other type of payment for injuries.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject

A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What does the consent form state about your right to withdraw from the study?
A) You may withdraw at any time, but it may affect your standard medical care.
B) You may withdraw at any time, and it will result in a financial penalty.
C) You may withdraw at any time without any impact on your medical care or other entitled benefits.
D) You cannot withdraw once you have signed the consent form.

Correct answer: C) You may withdraw at any time without any impact on your medical care or other entitled benefits.
